summary: Wireless carriers are starting to deploy 5G, the next generation of wireless technology. What does this mean for the FCC? FCC manages access to the radio frequency spectrum wireless carriers use to deliver services. Spectrum is a finite resource shared with other technologies like TV and radar. Carriers need more access to fully deploy 5G. 5G may also worsen the “digital divide.” People in rural...
title: 5G Deployment: FCC Needs Comprehensive Strategic Planning to Guide Its Efforts
